snippet: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index closed at its highest level since 2007 after a report showed that hiring held up in December, despite fiscal uncertainty in Washington.
abstract: Standard & Poor's 500-stock index closes at its highest level in five years, following report showing that hiring held up in December, giving stocks an early lift.
lead_paragraph: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index closed at its highest level since 2007 after a report showed that hiring held up in December, despite fiscal uncertainty in Washington.

headline.seo: S.&P. 500 Index Reaches 5-Year High After December Jobs Report
headline.main: S.&P. Reaches 5-Year High After Jobs Report
headline.print_headline: S.&P. Reaches 5-Year High After Jobs Report
